intro: Tragia keniensis, commonly known as the Kenyan tragia, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in semi-arid regions. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Tragia keniensis is known for its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions.
